page.title: 18Interesting Notes(cont'd)
page.content: 3. Chartist caves. So called because they were used by the Chartists to make weapons and bullets before the March and to hide in after. Also to the north of Trefil, still in existance but unsafe. 4. Cholera Cemetry. To be found alongside the existing Cefn Golau Cemetry. It is in a state of disrepair but still illustrates the extent of the cholera epidemic that struck the town in 1849 5. The Sirhowy Iron Works. The Sirhowy Iron Works now partly excavated and forming part of the heritage trail. 6. The Blocks of Coal in the park. The larger 15 tons cut by "Colleir Mawr" for the 1851 exhibition, the smaller two tons cut from the hinda level for the 1951 exhibition.
